Articles.Content:
Does anyone else have Mysterons in the new version?

Can anyone guess what really happened here?

Oh and I love the new bits!

Can anyone guess what really happened here?

Oh and I love the new bits!

I guess a decoupler is casting a shadow on the craft?

Awwww... It works fine...

I was hoping for Bananas....

After a brief look (because I have to work in 8 hours, stupid timezones!!) I have concluded that rockets are now held together by magic and that rest looks awesome but will have to wait because they deserve more time. Nice work Devs, you did it again.

Hi all --

I just started messing with the new release, and one of the first things I noticed is that the Illuminator lights now seem very overpowered. I have a few on one of my ground vehicles and when I turn them on it's like staring into the sun. Is the new light glare and over-bloom a bug or a feature? What do you all think; like it, hate it?

I am not on the hate side but I think ground detail is really washed out now so I hope they reduce the light intensity to previous levels at some point.

Lee

I guess a decoupler is casting a shadow on the craft?

Spot on, I was trying out the escape system and used one to dump the tower after a successful launch.

Spot on, I was trying out the escape system and used one to dump the tower after a successful launch.

What do I win?

I just started messing with the new release, and one of the first things I noticed is that the Illuminator lights now seem very overpowered. I have a few on one of my ground vehicles and when I turn them on it's like staring into the sun. Is the new light glare and over-bloom a bug or a feature? What do you all think; like it, hate it?

They can't be as OP as what the B9 lights do sometimes... Hey, lets light up the entire visible side of Duna! From Space!

In the part.cfg file, what does the new "explosion_potential" change????

Edit: Thanks to my occasional total stupididty, I haven't seen this before....

Edited April 1, 2014 by TechnicalK3rbal

In the part.cfg file, what does the new "explosion_potential" change????

How big explosions are, maybe?

Hi all --

I just started messing with the new release, and one of the first things I noticed is that the Illuminator lights now seem very overpowered. I have a few on one of my ground vehicles and when I turn them on it's like staring into the sun. Is the new light glare and over-bloom a bug or a feature? What do you all think; like it, hate it?

I am not on the hate side but I think ground detail is really washed out now so I hope they reduce the light intensity to previous levels at some point.

Lee

The round illuminates have always been overpowered. Try the rectangle ones.

I am not on the hate side but I think ground detail is really washed out now so I hope they reduce the light intensity to previous levels at some point.
Try right-clicking on them in the VAB/SPH for a spiffy new feature.

In the part.cfg file, what does the new "explosion_potential" change????

That's been there forever...
I fast forwarded for 12 in-game years and not a single unknown object spawned. I'm bummed. And yes, I toggled the thingie to show unknown on the map.

Does that mean that mod parts will still wobble and need to be redone?

Pls respond. Does larger mods parts require update do benefit from new joint system?

Pls respond. Does larger mods parts require update do benefit from new joint system?

Personally I wouldn't know kiwiak, and the devs are busy troubleshooting an issue that affects porting old saves. So we'll have to wait for the mod authors to see if this needs to be done.

They can't be as OP as what the B9 lights do sometimes... Hey, lets light up the entire visible side of Duna! From Space!

I know, it's so crazy when that happens. It's even funnier because I believe the description text says something about these lights not being able to light up a planet

Well, It's only a class A, and not at the KSC, but...

The rocket (didn't need the mainsail stage, the orange 2m bit, I way overdesigned it)

Just wow!!! The under the hood improvements are amazing at this patch. Can't wait for 0.24

Also my first A class asteroid capture with a rendezvous outside Kerbin's SOI

It seems I'll have to restart, as my heavily modded (Interstellar, DRE, FAR and 20+ more mods) setup has got new parts after update but locked the research facility (in career!) and hasn't got any asteroids. Still, great update!
NOOO IM AT WORK! cant wait till five tho!
Man, getting to asteroid is hard! I can fly to any body first thing in morning... But intercepting that rock in space, thats hard!

My favorite thing about this update were the under the hood improvements . I love the fact that I can actually appreciate the ocean in Kerbin. I have had this game for close to two years now, and only recently have I been able to appreciate the rivers that were added not too long ago. Good Job Squad!

Everytime my little computer chugs bast another megabyte, I stand up and cheer.

Onward, my liege!

Onward, my faithful steed!

28 seconds left.

My heart is pounding, and I cannot wait. Sweat begins to form on my forehead, and I quickly brush it away. The tension is rising.

5 seconds left.

Almost there, I murmur excitedly.

0 seconds.

I cheer so loudly that my neighbors phone my house and ask what's going on.

Time to get started!

___________________________________________________

Anyways, how have you been liking the update?

Its taking much longer while to load now, and some other issues may show up as I harness my space rockets and feed it to Jool

I fast forwarded for 12 in-game years and not a single unknown object spawned. I'm bummed. And yes, I toggled the thingie to show unknown on the map.

Are you using an old save from a previous version? That happened to me, but creating a new one seems to have solved it.

Edited April 1, 2014 by Felsmak
